data.title: Nobel Lecture Series: Alexander Solzhenitsyn
data.meta_description: Alexander Solzhenitsyn was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1970. He was a Russian novelist, historian, and short story writer. Solzhenitsyn is noted for the ethical force with which he pursued the indispensable traditions of Russian literature. Presented by Mark Lipovetsky, professor of Russian., powered by Localist Event Calendar Software
data.text: Alexander Solzhenitsyn was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1970. He was a Russian novelist, historian, and short story writer. Solzhenitsyn is noted for the ethical force with which he pursued the indispensable traditions of Russian literature. Presented by Mark Lipovetsky, professor of Russian.
